collections.description: Recite these adhkar after Fajr prayer until sunrise for protection and blessings throughout the day.

adhkar.arabicText:
أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ
اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْحَيُّ الْقَيُّومُ ۚ لَا تَأْخُذُهُ سِنَةٌ وَلَا نَوْمٌ ۚ لَهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۗ مَنْ ذَا الَّذِي يَشْفَعُ عِنْدَهُ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِ ۚ يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ ۖ وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِشَيْءٍ مِنْ عِلْمِهِ إِلَّا بِمَا شَاءَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۖ وَلَا يَئُودُهُ حِفْظُهُمَا ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَلِيُّ الْعَظِيمُ
adhkar.translation: Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is before them and what will be after them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
adhkar.transliteration: A'udhu billahi minash-shaitanir-rajim. Allahu la ilaha illa huwa al-hayyul-qayyum, la ta'khudhuhu sinatun wa la nawm, lahu ma fis-samawati wa ma fil-ard, man dhal-ladhi yashfa'u 'indahu illa bi-idhnih, ya'lamu ma bayna aydihim wa ma khalfahum, wa la yuhituna bi-shay'in min 'ilmihi illa bima sha'a, wasi'a kursiyyuhus-samawati wal-ard, wa la ya'uduhu hifdhuhuma, wa huwal-'aliyyul-'adhim.
adhkar.benefits: Whoever recites this in the morning will be protected until evening, and whoever recites it in the evening will be protected until morning.

adhkar.arabicText:
بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ، اللَّهُ الصَّمَدُ، لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ، وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ
adhkar.translation: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say, He is Allah, [who is] One, Allah, the Eternal Refuge. He neither begets nor is born, Nor is there to Him any equivalent.
adhkar.transliteration: Bismillahir-rahmanir-rahim. Qul huwa Allahu ahad, Allahus-samad, lam yalid wa lam yulad, wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan ahad.
adhkar.benefits: Reciting this three times is equivalent to reciting one-third of the Quran.

adhkar.arabicText:
بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَقِ، مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ، وَمِنْ شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ، وَمِنْ شَرِّ النَّفَّاثَاتِ فِي الْعُقَدِ، وَمِنْ شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ
adhkar.translation: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say, I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak, From the evil of that which He created, And from the evil of darkness when it settles, And from the evil of the blowers in knots, And from the evil of an envier when he envies.
adhkar.transliteration: Bismillahir-rahmanir-rahim. Qul a'udhu bi-rabbil-falaq, min sharri ma khalaq, wa min sharri ghasiqin idha waqab, wa min sharrin-naffathati fil-'uqad, wa min sharri hasidin idha hasad.
adhkar.benefits: Protection from all types of evil and harm.

adhkar.arabicText:
بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ، مَلِكِ النَّاسِ، إِلَٰهِ النَّاسِ، مِنْ شَرِّ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ، الَّذِي يُوَسْوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ النَّاسِ، مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ
adhkar.translation: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say, I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind, The Sovereign of mankind, The God of mankind, From the evil of the retreating whisperer, Who whispers [evil] into the breasts of mankind, From among the jinn and mankind.
adhkar.transliteration: Bismillahir-rahmanir-rahim. Qul a'udhu bi-rabbin-nas, malikin-nas, ilahin-nas, min sharril-waswasil-khannas, alladhi yuwaswisu fi sudurin-nas, minal-jinnati wan-nas.
adhkar.benefits: Protection from the whispers of Shaytan and evil thoughts.

adhkar.arabicText: أَصْبَحْنَا وَأَصْبَحَ الْمُلْكُ لِلَّهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، رَبِّ أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ مَا فِي هَٰذَا الْيَوْمِ وَخَيْرَ مَا بَعْدَهُ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا فِي هَٰذَا الْيَوْمِ وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهُ، رَبِّ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكَسَلِ وَسُوءِ الْكِبَرِ، رَبِّ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ فِي النَّارِ وَعَذَابٍ فِي الْقَبْرِ
adhkar.translation: We have entered a new day and with it all dominion is Allah's. Praise is to Allah. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. To Allah belongs the dominion, and to Him is the praise and He is Able to do all things. My Lord, I ask You for the goodness of this day and the goodness of what follows it, and I seek refuge in You from the evil of this day and the evil of what follows it. My Lord, I seek refuge in You from laziness and helpless old age. My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the Fire and the punishment of the grave.
adhkar.transliteration: Asbahna wa-asbahal-mulku lillah, walhamdu lillah, la ilaha illallahu wahdahu la sharika lah, lahul-mulku wa-lahul-hamd, wa-huwa 'ala kulli shay'in qadir. Rabbi as'aluka khayra ma fi hadhal-yawm wa-khayra ma ba'dah, wa-a'udhu bika min sharri ma fi hadhal-yawm wa-sharri ma ba'dah. Rabbi a'udhu bika minal-kasal wa-su'il-kibar. Rabbi a'udhu bika min 'adhabin fin-nar wa-'adhabin fil-qabr.

adhkar.arabicText: اللَّهُمَّ بِكَ أَصْبَحْنَا، وَبِكَ أَمْسَيْنَا، وَبِكَ نَحْيَا، وَبِكَ نَمُوتُ، وَإِلَيْكَ النُّشُورُ
adhkar.translation: O Allah, by You we enter the morning, and by You we enter the evening, by You we live and by You we die, and to You is the resurrection.
adhkar.transliteration: Allahumma bika asbahna, wa-bika amsayna, wa-bika nahya, wa-bika namutu, wa-ilaykan-nushur.

adhkar.arabicText: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ رَبِّي لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ، خَلَقْتَنِي وَأَنَا عَبْدُكَ، وَأَنَا عَلَىٰ عَهْدِكَ وَوَعْدِكَ مَا اسْتَطَعْتُ، أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا صَنَعْتُ، أَبُوءُ لَكَ بِنِعْمَتِكَ عَلَيَّ، وَأَبُوءُ بِذَنْبِي فَاغْفِرْ لِي، فَإِنَّهُ لَا يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ
adhkar.translation: O Allah, You are my Lord, there is none worthy of worship but You. You created me and I am Your slave. I keep Your covenant, and my pledge to You so far as I am able. I seek refuge in You from the evil of what I have done. I admit to Your blessings upon me, and I admit to my misdeeds. Forgive me, for there is none who may forgive sins but You.
adhkar.transliteration: Allahumma anta rabbi la ilaha illa ant, khalaqtani wa-ana 'abduk, wa-ana 'ala 'ahdika wa-wa'dika mas-tata't, a'udhu bika min sharri ma sana't, abu'u laka bi-ni'matika 'alayy, wa-abu'u bi-dhanbi faghfir li, fa-innahu la yaghfirudh-dhunuba illa ant.
adhkar.benefits: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever says this with firm conviction in the evening and dies that night, will enter Paradise, and whoever says it with firm conviction in the morning and dies that day, will enter Paradise.'

adhkar.arabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَصْبَحْتُ أُشْهِدُكَ، وَأُشْهِدُ حَمَلَةَ عَرْشِكَ، وَمَلَائِكَتَكَ، وَجَمِيعَ خَلْقِكَ، أَنَّكَ أَنْتَ اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ وَحْدَكَ لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ، وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُكَ وَرَسُولُكَ
adhkar.translation: O Allah, I have entered a new morning and call upon You and upon the bearers of Your Throne, and upon Your angels and all creation to bear witness that surely You are Allah, there is none worthy of worship but You alone, You have no partners, and that Muhammad is Your slave and Your Messenger.
adhkar.transliteration: Allahumma inni asbahtu ushhiduk, wa-ushhidu hamalata 'arshik, wa-mala'ikatak, wa-jami'a khalqik, annaka antallahu la ilaha illa anta wahdaka la sharika lak, wa-anna Muhammadan 'abduka wa-rasuluk.
adhkar.benefits: Whoever says this four times in the morning or evening, Allah will free a quarter of him from the Fire. If he says it four times, Allah will free him entirely from the Fire.

adhkar.arabicText: اللَّهُمَّ مَا أَصْبَحَ بِي مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ أَوْ بِأَحَدٍ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ فَمِنْكَ وَحْدَكَ لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ، فَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ وَلَكَ الشُّكْرُ
adhkar.translation: O Allah, whatever blessing has been received by me or anyone of Your creation is from You alone, You have no partner. All praise is for you and thanks is to You.
adhkar.transliteration: Allahumma ma asbaha bi min ni'matin aw bi-ahadin min khalqika faminka wahdaka la sharika lak, falakal-hamdu wa-lakash-shukr.
adhkar.benefits: Whoever says this in the morning has fulfilled his obligation of thanks for that day.

adhkar.arabicText: حَسْبِيَ اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ عَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ وَهُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ
adhkar.translation: Allah is sufficient for me. There is none worthy of worship but Him. I have placed my trust in Him, and He is the Lord of the Magnificent Throne.
adhkar.transliteration: Hasbiyallahu la ilaha illa huwa 'alayhi tawakkaltu wa-huwa rabbul-'arshil-'adhim.
adhkar.benefits: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever says this seven times in the morning or evening, Allah will take care of whatever worries him.'

adhkar.arabicText: اللَّهُمَّ عَافِنِي فِي بَدَنِي، اللَّهُمَّ عَافِنِي فِي سَمْعِي، اللَّهُمَّ عَافِنِي فِي بَصَرِي، لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ
adhkar.translation: O Allah, grant me health in my body. O Allah, grant me health in my hearing. O Allah, grant me health in my sight. There is none worthy of worship but You.
adhkar.transliteration: Allahumma 'afini fi badani, Allahumma 'afini fi sam'i, Allahumma 'afini fi basari, la ilaha illa ant.

adhkar.arabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكُفْرِ، وَالْفَقْرِ، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابِ الْقَبْرِ، لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ
adhkar.translation: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from disbelief and poverty, and I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the grave. There is none worthy of worship but You.
adhkar.transliteration: Allahumma inni a'udhu bika minal-kufr, wal-faqr, wa-a'udhu bika min 'adhabil-qabr, la ilaha illa ant.

adhkar.arabicText: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الَّذِي لَا يَضُرُّ مَعَ اسْمِهِ شَيْءٌ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِي السَّمَاءِ وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
adhkar.translation: In the Name of Allah, with Whose Name nothing can harm in the earth nor in the heaven, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
adhkar.transliteration: Bismillahil-ladhi la yadurru ma'as-mihi shay'un fil-ardi wa-la fis-sama', wa-huwas-sami'ul-'alim.
adhkar.benefits: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever says this three times in the morning will not be afflicted by any calamity before evening, and whoever says it three times in the evening will not be overtaken by any calamity before morning.'

adhkar.arabicText: رَضِيتُ بِاللَّهِ رَبًّا، وَبِالْإِسْلَامِ دِينًا، وَبِمُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ نَبِيًّا
adhkar.translation: I am pleased with Allah as my Lord, with Islam as my religion, and with Muhammad (peace be upon him) as my Prophet.
adhkar.transliteration: Raditu billahi rabba, wa-bil-islami dina, wa-bi-Muhammadin (sallallahu 'alayhi wa-sallam) nabiyya.
adhkar.benefits: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever says this three times in the morning or evening, Allah will surely please him on the Day of Resurrection.'

adhkar.arabicText: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ
adhkar.translation: Glory is to Allah and praise is to Him.
adhkar.transliteration: Subhanallahi wa-bihamdihi.
adhkar.benefits: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever says this one hundred times a day, his sins will be wiped away, even if they are like the foam of the sea.'

adhkar.arabicText: لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
adhkar.translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah alone, with no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He has power over all things.
adhkar.transliteration: La ilaha illallahu wahdahu la sharika lah, lahul-mulku wa-lahul-hamd, wa-huwa 'ala kulli shay'in qadir.
adhkar.benefits: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever says this ten times will have the reward of freeing four slaves from the children of Isma'il.'

adhkar.arabicText: اللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ وَسَلِّمْ عَلَىٰ نَبِيِّنَا مُحَمَّدٍ
adhkar.translation: O Allah, send prayers and peace upon our Prophet Muhammad.
adhkar.transliteration: Allahumma salli wa-sallim 'ala nabiyyina Muhammad.
adhkar.benefits: Sending blessings upon the Prophet brings us closer to him on the Day of Judgment.

adhkar.arabicText: أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ وَأَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ
adhkar.translation: I seek forgiveness from Allah and repent to Him.
adhkar.transliteration: Astaghfirullah wa-atubu ilayh.
adhkar.benefits: The Prophet ﷺ used to seek Allah's forgiveness more than seventy times a day.

adhkar.arabicText:
بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ، مَلِكِ النَّاسِ، إِلَٰهِ النَّاسِ، مِنْ شَرِّ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ، الَّذِي يُوَسْوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ النَّاسِ، مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ
adhkar.translation: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say, I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind, The Sovereign of mankind, The God of mankind, From the evil of the retreating whisperer, Who whispers [evil] into the breasts of mankind, From among the jinn and mankind.
adhkar.transliteration: Bismillahir-rahmanir-rahim. Qul a'udhu bi-rabbin-nas, malikin-nas, ilahin-nas, min sharril-waswasil-khannas, alladhi yuwaswisu fi sudurin-nas, minal-jinnati wan-nas.
adhkar.benefits: Protection from the whispers of Shaytan and evil thoughts.

adhkar.arabicText: أَمْسَيْنَا وَأَمْسَى الْمُلْكُ لِلَّهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، رَبِّ أَسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ مَا فِي هَٰذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ وَخَيْرَ مَا بَعْدَهَا، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا فِي هَٰذِهِ اللَّيْلَةِ وَشَرِّ مَا بَعْدَهَا، رَبِّ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكَسَلِ وَسُوءِ الْكِبَرِ، رَبِّ أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذَابٍ فِي النَّارِ وَعَذَابٍ فِي الْقَبْرِ
adhkar.translation: We have entered the evening and with it all dominion is Allah's. Praise is to Allah. None has the right to be worshipped but Allah alone, Who has no partner. To Allah belongs the dominion, and to Him is the praise and He is Able to do all things. My Lord, I ask You for the goodness of this night and the goodness of what follows it, and I seek refuge in You from the evil of this night and the evil of what follows it. My Lord, I seek refuge in You from laziness and helpless old age. My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the Fire and the punishment of the grave.
adhkar.transliteration: Amsayna wa-amsal-mulku lillah, walhamdu lillah, la ilaha illallahu wahdahu la sharika lah, lahul-mulku wa-lahul-hamd, wa-huwa 'ala kulli shay'in qadir. Rabbi as'aluka khayra ma fi hadhihil-laylah wa-khayra ma ba'daha, wa-a'udhu bika min sharri ma fi hadhihil-laylah wa-sharri ma ba'daha. Rabbi a'udhu bika minal-kasal wa-su'il-kibar. Rabbi a'udhu bika min 'adhabin fin-nar wa-'adhabin fil-qabr.

adhkar.arabicText: اللَّهُمَّ بِكَ أَمْسَيْنَا، وَبِكَ أَصْبَحْنَا، وَبِكَ نَحْيَا، وَبِكَ نَمُوتُ، وَإِلَيْكَ الْمَصِيرُ
adhkar.translation: O Allah, by You we enter the evening, and by You we enter the morning, by You we live and by You we die, and to You is the final return.
adhkar.transliteration: Allahumma bika amsayna, wa-bika asbahna, wa-bika nahya, wa-bika namutu, wa-ilaykal-masir.

adhkar.arabicText: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ رَبِّي لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ، خَلَقْتَنِي وَأَنَا عَبْدُكَ، وَأَنَا عَلَىٰ عَهْدِكَ وَوَعْدِكَ مَا اسْتَطَعْتُ، أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا صَنَعْتُ، أَبُوءُ لَكَ بِنِعْمَتِكَ عَلَيَّ، وَأَبُوءُ بِذَنْبِي فَاغْفِرْ لِي، فَإِنَّهُ لَا يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ
adhkar.translation: O Allah, You are my Lord, there is none worthy of worship but You. You created me and I am Your slave. I keep Your covenant, and my pledge to You so far as I am able. I seek refuge in You from the evil of what I have done. I admit to Your blessings upon me, and I admit to my misdeeds. Forgive me, for there is none who may forgive sins but You.
adhkar.transliteration: Allahumma anta rabbi la ilaha illa ant, khalaqtani wa-ana 'abduk, wa-ana 'ala 'ahdika wa-wa'dika mas-tata't, a'udhu bika min sharri ma sana't, abu'u laka bi-ni'matika 'alayy, wa-abu'u bi-dhanbi faghfir li, fa-innahu la yaghfirudh-dhunuba illa ant.
adhkar.benefits: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever says this with firm conviction in the evening and dies that night, will enter Paradise.'

adhkar.arabicText: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَمْسَيْتُ أُشْهِدُكَ، وَأُشْهِدُ حَمَلَةَ عَرْشِكَ، وَمَلَائِكَتَكَ، وَجَمِيعَ خَلْقِكَ، أَنَّكَ أَنْتَ اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا أَنْتَ وَحْدَكَ لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ، وَأَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُكَ وَرَسُولُكَ
adhkar.translation: O Allah, I have entered the evening and call upon You and upon the bearers of Your Throne, and upon Your angels and all creation to bear witness that surely You are Allah, there is none worthy of worship but You alone, You have no partners, and that Muhammad is Your slave and Your Messenger.
adhkar.transliteration: Allahumma inni amsaytu ushhiduk, wa-ushhidu hamalata 'arshik, wa-mala'ikatak, wa-jami'a khalqik, annaka antallahu la ilaha illa anta wahdaka la sharika lak, wa-anna Muhammadan 'abduka wa-rasuluk.
adhkar.benefits: Whoever says this four times in the evening, Allah will free a quarter of him from the Fire. If he says it four times, Allah will free him entirely from the Fire.

adhkar.arabicText: اللَّهُمَّ مَا أَمْسَى بِي مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ أَوْ بِأَحَدٍ مِنْ خَلْقِكَ فَمِنْكَ وَحْدَكَ لَا شَرِيكَ لَكَ، فَلَكَ الْحَمْدُ وَلَكَ الشُّكْرُ
adhkar.translation: O Allah, whatever blessing has been received by me or anyone of Your creation is from You alone, You have no partner. All praise is for you and thanks is to You.
adhkar.transliteration: Allahumma ma amsa bi min ni'matin aw bi-ahadin min khalqika faminka wahdaka la sharika lak, falakal-hamdu wa-lakash-shukr.
adhkar.benefits: Whoever says this in the evening has fulfilled his obligation of thanks for that day.

adhkar.arabicText: حَسْبِيَ اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ عَلَيْهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ وَهُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْعَظِيمِ
adhkar.translation: Allah is sufficient for me. There is none worthy of worship but Him. I have placed my trust in Him, and He is the Lord of the Magnificent Throne.
adhkar.transliteration: Hasbiyallahu la ilaha illa huwa 'alayhi tawakkaltu wa-huwa rabbul-'arshil-'adhim.
adhkar.benefits: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever says this seven times in the evening, Allah will take care of whatever worries him.'

adhkar.arabicText: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الَّذِي لَا يَضُرُّ مَعَ اسْمِهِ شَيْءٌ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِي السَّمَاءِ وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
adhkar.translation: In the Name of Allah, with Whose Name nothing can harm in the earth nor in the heaven, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
adhkar.transliteration: Bismillahil-ladhi la yadurru ma'as-mihi shay'un fil-ardi wa-la fis-sama', wa-huwas-sami'ul-'alim.
adhkar.benefits: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever says this three times in the evening will not be overtaken by any calamity before morning.'

adhkar.arabicText: رَضِيتُ بِاللَّهِ رَبًّا، وَبِالْإِسْلَامِ دِينًا، وَبِمُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ نَبِيًّا
adhkar.translation: I am pleased with Allah as my Lord, with Islam as my religion, and with Muhammad (peace be upon him) as my Prophet.
adhkar.transliteration: Raditu billahi rabba, wa-bil-islami dina, wa-bi-Muhammadin (sallallahu 'alayhi wa-sallam) nabiyya.
adhkar.benefits: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever says this three times in the evening, Allah will surely please him on the Day of Resurrection.'

collections.description: Recite these adhkar after completing each of the five daily prayers.

adhkar.arabicText: أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ
adhkar.translation: I seek the forgiveness of Allah.
adhkar.transliteration: Astaghfirullah.

adhkar.arabicText: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ السَّلَامُ وَمِنْكَ السَّلَامُ، تَبَارَكْتَ يَا ذَا الْجَلَالِ وَالْإِكْرَامِ
adhkar.translation: O Allah, You are Peace and from You comes peace. Blessed are You, O Owner of Majesty and Honor.
adhkar.transliteration: Allahumma antas-salam wa-minkas-salam, tabarakta ya dhal-jalali wal-ikram.

adhkar.arabicText: لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، اللَّهُمَّ لَا مَانِعَ لِمَا أَعْطَيْتَ، وَلَا مُعْطِيَ لِمَا مَنَعْتَ، وَلَا يَنْفَعُ ذَا الْجَدِّ مِنْكَ الْجَدُّ
adhkar.translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah alone, with no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He has power over all things. O Allah, there is none who can withhold what You give, and none may give what You have withheld; and the might of the mighty person cannot benefit him against You.
adhkar.transliteration: La ilaha illallahu wahdahu la sharika lah, lahul-mulku wa-lahul-hamd, wa-huwa 'ala kulli shay'in qadir. Allahumma la mani'a lima a'tayt, wa-la mu'tiya lima mana't, wa-la yanfa'u dhal-jaddi minkal-jadd.

adhkar.arabicText: لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ، لَا حَوْلَ وَلَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِاللَّهِ، لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ، وَلَا نَعْبُدُ إِلَّا إِيَّاهُ، لَهُ النِّعْمَةُ وَلَهُ الْفَضْلُ وَلَهُ الثَّنَاءُ الْحَسَنُ، لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ الدِّينَ وَلَوْ كَرِهَ الْكَافِرُونَ
adhkar.translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah alone, with no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He has power over all things. There is no power and no might except by Allah. There is none worthy of worship but Allah, and we worship none but Him. His is grace, and His is bounty, and to Him belongs the most excellent praise. There is none worthy of worship but Allah. (We are) sincere in making our religious devotion to Him, even though the disbelievers may dislike it.
adhkar.transliteration: La ilaha illallahu wahdahu la sharika lah, lahul-mulku wa-lahul-hamd, wa-huwa 'ala kulli shay'in qadir. La hawla wa-la quwwata illa billah, la ilaha illallah, wa-la na'budu illa iyyah, lahun-ni'matu wa-lahul-fadl, wa-lahuth-thana'ul-hasan. La ilaha illallahu mukhlisina lahud-din wa-law karihal-kafirun.

adhkar.arabicText: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ
adhkar.translation: Glory is to Allah.
adhkar.transliteration: Subhanallah.
adhkar.benefits: These glorifications after each prayer are a means of forgiveness for sins even if they are like the foam of the sea.

adhkar.arabicText: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ
adhkar.translation: All praise is to Allah.
adhkar.transliteration: Alhamdulillah.

adhkar.arabicText: اللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ
adhkar.translation: Allah is the Greatest.
adhkar.transliteration: Allahu akbar.

adhkar.arabicText: لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
adhkar.translation: There is none worthy of worship but Allah alone, with no partner. His is the dominion and His is the praise, and He has power over all things.
adhkar.transliteration: La ilaha illallahu wahdahu la sharika lah, lahul-mulku wa-lahul-hamd, wa-huwa 'ala kulli shay'in qadir.
adhkar.benefits: Completing to 100 with this statement. The Prophet ﷺ said whoever does this after each prayer will have his sins forgiven even if they are like the foam of the sea.

adhkar.arabicText:
أَعُوذُ بِاللَّهِ مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ
اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْحَيُّ الْقَيُّومُ ۚ لَا تَأْخُذُهُ سِنَةٌ وَلَا نَوْمٌ ۚ لَهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۗ مَنْ ذَا الَّذِي يَشْفَعُ عِنْدَهُ إِلَّا بِإِذْنِهِ ۚ يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ ۖ وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِشَيْءٍ مِنْ عِلْمِهِ إِلَّا بِمَا شَاءَ ۚ وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۖ وَلَا يَئُودُهُ حِفْظُهُمَا ۚ وَهُوَ الْعَلِيُّ الْعَظِيمُ
adhkar.translation: Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is before them and what will be after them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
adhkar.transliteration: A'udhu billahi minash-shaitanir-rajim. Allahu la ilaha illa huwa al-hayyul-qayyum, la ta'khudhuhu sinatun wa la nawm, lahu ma fis-samawati wa ma fil-ard, man dhal-ladhi yashfa'u 'indahu illa bi-idhnih, ya'lamu ma bayna aydihim wa ma khalfahum, wa la yuhituna bi-shay'in min 'ilmihi illa bima sha'a, wasi'a kursiyyuhus-samawati wal-ard, wa la ya'uduhu hifdhuhuma, wa huwal-'aliyyul-'adhim.
adhkar.benefits: The Prophet ﷺ said: 'Whoever recites this after every obligatory prayer, nothing prevents him from entering Paradise except death.'

adhkar.arabicText:
بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ، اللَّهُ الصَّمَدُ، لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ، وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ كُفُوًا أَحَدٌ
adhkar.translation: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say, He is Allah, [who is] One, Allah, the Eternal Refuge. He neither begets nor is born, Nor is there to Him any equivalent.
adhkar.transliteration: Bismillahir-rahmanir-rahim. Qul huwa Allahu ahad, Allahus-samad, lam yalid wa lam yulad, wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan ahad.
adhkar.benefits: After Maghrib and Fajr, recite three times each.

adhkar.arabicText:
بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَقِ، مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ، وَمِنْ شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ، وَمِنْ شَرِّ النَّفَّاثَاتِ فِي الْعُقَدِ، وَمِنْ شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ
adhkar.translation: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say, I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak, From the evil of that which He created, And from the evil of darkness when it settles, And from the evil of the blowers in knots, And from the evil of an envier when he envies.
adhkar.transliteration: Bismillahir-rahmanir-rahim. Qul a'udhu bi-rabbil-falaq, min sharri ma khalaq, wa min sharri ghasiqin idha waqab, wa min sharrin-naffathati fil-'uqad, wa min sharri hasidin idha hasad.
adhkar.benefits: After Maghrib and Fajr, recite three times each.

adhkar.arabicText:
بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ، مَلِكِ النَّاسِ، إِلَٰهِ النَّاسِ، مِنْ شَرِّ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ، الَّذِي يُوَسْوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ النَّاسِ، مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ
adhkar.translation: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say, I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind, The Sovereign of mankind, The God of mankind, From the evil of the retreating whisperer, Who whispers [evil] into the breasts of mankind, From among the jinn and mankind.
adhkar.transliteration: Bismillahir-rahmanir-rahim. Qul a'udhu bi-rabbin-nas, malikin-nas, ilahin-nas, min sharril-waswasil-khannas, alladhi yuwaswisu fi sudurin-nas, minal-jinnati wan-nas.
adhkar.benefits: After Maghrib and Fajr, recite three times each.
